page.title: 01A Description of N.E.Bolton
page.content: N.E.Bolton consists of hills dissected by steepsided valleys running North-South. Since 1950 it has changed from a rural area into a suburb of Bolton-forming the edge of the Manchester conurbation. Modern housing has been built on the slopes of the hills,engulfing the old hamlets and the 19th century housing. It has retained its popularity as a residential area because much open space has been preserved and amenities have kept pace with growth,although there is a shortage of post and telephone boxes. The main problem in the future is to decide whether further growth should be allowed.Residents are opposed to it because traffic congestion is already great but a recent decision to prevent further building was overturned by a government minister.
